cons: Slow seasons makes it hard to maintain consistent hours if you’re not FT and they will cancel you back to back without asking FT ppl if they would prefer to take PTO. No compensation for your trouble when canceled last minute. Not many opportunities to up.

pros: They encourage growth from within the organization which is great for someone looking for opportunities. The leadership have always been supportive and encouraging. They truly live their Mission and Values as a Community focused Non-Profit organization.
cons: The usual struggles apply as with most non-profits. It can be challenging to do the work with compensation and resources that may not reflect the typical or more competitive for-profit market. It can take them time to catch up to those trends because of the focus on community investment. Depending on your perspective, that may or may not be a “con”. They are growing very quickly, which is always somewhat stressful but they are very supportive throughout the process.

pros: Being part of the mission to help people

pros: Some amazing hospice minded people in the institution, unfortunately, a whole lot of "corporate" type behavior has taken root. Much incompetence in the leadership roles become frustrating. Lazy manipulative coworkers are not penalized sadly, they are just allowed to affect everyone and go unchecked for the longest time. People here get super stressed about benign things and don't care about the big stuff. Its okay if you can figure out how to avoid the drama. Retaliation from upper management is a very real problem. Luckily some young and competent leaders have started to be hired that aren't punitive minded.
cons: So many changes, weak leaders, lazy coworkers.

A growing company that is forward thinking.  They have big goals and are willing to work collaboratively with their employees to achieve them.
A company that cares about patients and employees.

review_title: Missing leadership when it’s needed most
pros: The patients, families and teams are awesome. The mission is why I came here and want to stay here.
cons:
The medical directors are silly busy trying to do everything the CMO has delegated to them... with no help from him.  The rest of the physicians are slingshotted all over the place to try to cover because the CMO doesn’t appear to have a discernible plan and no apparent interest in our patients.  It is not effective to sit in an office and put out directives with limited understanding of what it takes to implement them or the impact to the physicians. 

We are a hospice.  Not a palliative care practice.  Our CMO and upper management don’t  seem to recognize or appreciate that.  Why do we have to pay prior hospice docs to come back on contract to testify about hospice when we have a CMO?  Why isn’t that role capable of testifying after almost three years on board?  I’ll tell you why, it’s because the role has not learned or cared about hospice.  We all know it and someday the emperor will too. 

We are working feverishly to try to care for our hospice patients.  Please help us do so.

job_title: Care Team Assistant in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: great co-workers and love the clientele
cons: No room for promotion, leadership very political

pros: 6bweeks of Paid time off a year
cons: Terrible health insurance. Very high deductible

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Pinellas Park, FL
pros: Flexible work schedule. Nice PTO
cons: Poor rate of pay. Health insurance poor.

review_title: Was the best job in the world, now very disillusioned.
pros: Bringing comfort to dying patients and family members. For thirty plus years the hospice team  worked like a fine Swiss watch to provide true and honest care for the patient and family. They are trying to work on the salary issues for the employees.Will continue to try and hang in there because I believe the work we do is important.
cons: Massive turnover of employees including long time leadership who set the tone for the entire organization. In the past two years we have lost outstanding leaders, excellent RN case managers and compassionate continuous care nurses.  Weekly there are goodbyes from outstanding employees who are "retiring."  Hospice cannot hire fast enough to replace them.    Massive confusion, intimidation, no personal life, and lots of lips service.  I talked with a number of nurses that said that orientation was like talking to a new car salesman, six months later they have "found out they have been sold a lemon."

review_title: Dont believe the lies they will tell you!!
pros: The salary is good. The mission is good and they do alot for the community as a whole. Great doctors!
cons: Management have no EMPATHY! Workers are treated like slaves. You do t k ow what you are really getting into as what they say in the interview is totally different than the job you are required to do.  The admission managers are rude and uncaring. You work 50 to 60 hours with no overtime. If you break the salary down into the hours worked you are making way less money than you should as an RN.  No paid holidays at all. You have to use PTO for everything and getting a day off is a joke. Only 2 nurses can be off a day. The orientation to the company is great, but the orientation for your actual position is seriously lacking. Gas mileage pay is a joke. They dont give you anything extra at all u less you drive to the office first, but if you do go to the office you get told to stop coming to the office everyday. Empath Health is the worst company ever to work for. At least in the Admissions Department. HR is no help and do not back up the employees.

review_title: Working here is rewarding but becoming exhausting.
job_title: RN Case Manager in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: The field staff are fantastic, knowledgeable and team oriented.  Color team office staff are fantastic.  Doctors are amazing!  Salary is pretty good, benefits are pretty good.  Respected company in the community.  Making a difference in so many lives at the worst time of their lives is very rewarding. So many wonderful things about working for this company.
cons: Staff retention of nurses is horrific.  The On Call is usually the decider to leave, along with increased caseloads, which leads to hours and hours of charting on your own time.

review_title: Run! Since new CEO took over too many sad changes
pros: Benefits are not too bad, and they give you extra $ if you do their fitbit program to your HSA.
cons:
They blame you for things you did not do without talking to you. They support their office staff. Nurses are expected to do back bends, and chart after hours (Nurses are salary) to meet the patient's needs as they are understaffed as everyone is hired and leaving. If you get hurt and need to do the physical (which is crazy hard and you will hurt for days later), and are unable to pass it nurses have been let go since there are no jobs for them at that time. 
You are on backup call for only $1.50 and hour and if you worked all day and on call all night you could be out all night plus need to work again the next day. It is not safe!!!!!!!! 
The new Season's is coming into Pinellas county and I am sure many of the staff will leave and go to the new hospice!

job_title: Operations Manager in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: I have worked at ASAP/Empath Health for over 4 years.  My career path has found me working in the religious/private/govt/and non-profit sectors.  Of those, my experience with ASAP/Empath Health rates as one of the highest and most rewarding opportunities to serve others.  It is here that  staff are valued for their ability to bring compassionate care to those who are at a most vulnerable time in their lives, anticipating their next need.  Staff are valued here as demonstrated by generous benefits, a great working environment, and the autonomy afforded to us to be about our work as a mission and not just a job.  I hope that it is at ASAP/Empath Health where I will eventually retire.  It's that good!
cons: Any cons that rise to the level of sharing them, if any, in this forum would seem to me to be trying to just come up with some.  I can't really come up with any.

review_title: Extremely happy in my roles with Suncoast Hospice!
pros: More and more every day, people are being held accountable in their jobs.  If you work hard, it's extremely rewarding.  Things are constantly changing but in a good way.  My team is awesome and great to work with.  It's a very collaborative environment so while it may take time for a process to change, there's much thought and discussion put into every decision/change.
cons: Some employees are resistant to change.  This makes it difficult for those who are ready to move in a different direction that in years past.  Some technical difficulties continue but there are improvements made every day.  Communication isn't disseminated to lower levels as it should be, leaving a lot of employees unaware about what's going on in other departments.

pros: Everyone appears friendly, hours are somewhat flexible, and their locations are beautiful.
cons: Everyone may appear friendly, but they are truly out to stab you in the back the first chance they get. Especially those in human resources. The positive reviews you see on here were likely written by the staff in HR to increase their rating. It's unfortunate, but true. Since the new CEO has taken over, this company is no longer about the people, rather they are all about the money. There is no such thing as a work/life balance. You are expected to work insane amounts of hours for the below market value pay you receive. Just when you think you're getting help, they let terminate someone else and you're back at square one. Don't bother complaining to management, they do not care. Though, they will pretend to care! You'll walk away feeling like they are going to do something only to find out that nothing is done and ultimately your complaint put your job at risk.

review_title: Lots of unpaid overtime, poor communication between staff and management. inefficient and virtually no training.
pros: autonomy compared to bedside care, the patients and families were wonderful. compensation ok if you work scheduled hours only otherwise not enough for all the overtime
cons: unpaid overtime, on call requirement, monitoring "productivity" vs. just taking care of patients, training is minimal, unwieldy, and unrealistic with actual job.  receive lots of negative criticism across the board from different departments- commendations for jobs well done are rare.

pros: The best was caring for the patients. I loved being out in the field. There was a lot of team support as well.
cons: Management is very top heavy. Instead of the agency being about the care and quality of life for patients, management now only cares about productivity and numbers. I've heard many patients who have had subpar care since the new changes. It used to be rare and that saddens me greatly. Also employees are being more and more bogged down which makes it hard to drop what you're doing to help a patient in a crisis. Work is not 8-5. Much documentation has to be completed after hours.

review_title: This is a very unethical company!
job_title: Staff RN in Palm Harbor, FL
pros: Zero... worked there for two months - big mistake!!! I worked very hard paid to buy several scrubs and a computer bag, this company cost me more money then they paid me .
cons: They accepted my two weeks notice! Then I show up to work and the manager said you can stop working today! So I left ... the outcome was that they are refusing to give me my 29 hours of p to that they owe me... I had saved it up. To weeks later I was told that I didn't give notice and that due to performance issues I was terminated!! With no p t o .... that is a lie I will seek help from an attorney next!!

review_title: Horrible management, poor salary and expected to work 80 hours a week for 40 hour salary
pros: Issue you a phone and an old laptop that barely works
cons: Management on "teams" shows favoritism, and constant negative feedback. Unappreciated for the work that you do. You will work 80 hours plus a week charting, and get paid (poorly) for 40 hours if lucky!  This was a toxic work environment with horrible PFCC's (leadership) and lazy Senior Staff nurses.  Constant gossip and lack of compassion, totally not focused on patient care. Very sad, since Hospice used to be patient based.

review_title: Not much of a place to work.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Clearwater, FL
pros: Great bunch of nurses to work with who really care and do a great job,  many opportunities to earn CEUs and  Rewarding work.  Great PRN department.
cons: Company tries to discourage you working F/T.  They don't like it when you have benefits and earn a fair wage, they have no pharmacy, or DME and discourage patients from being in their home where they are most comfortable.They would rather the patient go to the hospice house where Empath would make more money. They don't like LPNs on the teams.  The new CEO is DISTROYING everything Mary built.

review_title: Leader in Hospice Care in the Ever Changing World of Hospice
pros: It's an organization that lives its mission statement and perhaps the only one I've worked for that has consistently delivered on its promises to the community it serves.  It was an honor to work there and to represent this organization.  When it comes to end-of-life issues, there is no time for politicking and decisions predicated on revenue.  This hospice did what was right for the patients and families they served.  Doing the right thing was not always the most profitable thing, financially.  But it's this kind of compassion that has established it as an industry leader.
cons:
For over three decades, Suncoast Hospice has been the only hospice in Pinellas County, FL.  This is due to the certificate of need regulations that exist in the state of FL.  However, times are changing... it seems that competition is a reality that the organization will soon have to deal with.   This is both good and bad.  It could be ideal if the leadership in the organization responds with prudence and foresight.  It could be disastrous if the leadership and others within the organization fail to realize that former greatness does not guarantee future success. 
Also, it's no secret that the salary at this organization is not consistent with the for-profit sector of this industry and not commensurate with an organization of its reputation and caliber.  There are many perks that don't make there way into your paycheck.  But in times of economic downturn and uncertainty, some qualified candidates may go elsewhere.

pros: Our community reputation is still positive.
cons: How long before our reputation is tarnished for good? We face challenges with less funding but our current leadership plans are bleeding away many long term, experienced frontline staff. You can't just replace experience with warm bodies.

review_title: Company with a Heart that makes a Difference in Many Lives
pros: Leadership is very supportive of all employees and continuously strives to make improvements quickly whenever possible when  suggestions are made.  Very rewarding career....families and patients are appreciative and touched by the excellent care they receive from everyone from clinical staff to supportive staff. Many staff with great longevity and dedicated employees. Beautiful holistic care of pts/families. Great support departments.  Excellent learning and benefits. Honorable company and very well respected in the community.
cons: Often daily changes to schedules (great if you don't like monotony), call (usually one night a week and one w/e every 4-6 wks)

pros: Helping people during the dying process. This is a very rewarding job! The employees are wonderful! The other employees are kind and helpful and some of the best people to work with ever. The benefits are very good.
cons: The left hand never knows what the right hand is doing. There is never enough staff. The computer system is the slowest and most user unfriendly ever. The pay is very bad. Too much money is used trying to keep other hospice out of Pinellas County instead of retaining employees with decent pay. Our founder died and unfortunately her ideas and dreams died with her.

pros: Flexibility.  CEO who has open door policy and is moving our company forward. Invites  suggestions and opinions.  Coworkers willing to help each other to get the job done.  Caring for terminally ill  in There setting.  Being able to offer choices to patients and families   Benefits are very good.  Health dental vision plus many others.  Don't wait 60-90 days for insurance. Very generous PTO
cons: Weekend and week night on call.  Wages could be better.   Middle management not well trained or friendly

review_title: Great opportunity to serve your community.
pros: Very fulfilling work. The focus is definitely on patients and families and serving our community. Excellent benefits. Beautiful facilities. There are many talented and well educated employees on staff.
cons: At times, it seems that there are not enough opportunities for career growth for non-clinical employees. I struggle with the desire to continue with the agency and the feeling that I am short changing my career.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Loved my patients and walking their journey with them. Loved my work family. Loved how our work revolved around the patient and family.............and then it changed:(
cons: New CEO came in and the firings began....the whole atmosphere changed after Mary Labyak died so did Suncoast Hospice.........It is now a culture of fear and you will work 12-14 hours a day ....it is no longer about the patient and family

job_title: Registered Nurse Manager BSN in Palm Harbor, FL
pros: Changes how you look at, value and live your life. Uses all of your experience & training. No two days are the same. Truly collaborative team environment. You never have to question whether you are contributing to a better world- you are !
cons: Heart tugging work. You must have things & people in your life that can support you and refill your tank. Without defined boundaries, this work can seep into personal life.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palm Harbor, FL
pros: Suncoast Hospice/Empath Heath is caring for the community. I have worked here over 10 years and have learned and grown as a professional.  We are a service oriented non-profit organization, we care about each other and offer the best care for hospice, home health, PACE, etc. I love my job and look forward to retiring from Empath in another 10+ years.
cons: Some challenges with middle management that are being address slowly.

pros: The mission of this company is why I applied. I believe the patients are first and foremost.
cons: I have worked here for just about 2 years. Not planning to stay much longer. Health benefits are the worse I have ever had. Employees are pretty miserable and unfriendly.  A lot of gossip going on.  Over worked.

pros: Field staff work closely with patients and families. I learned how to really care about people. This shaped my character in a positive way.
cons: The organization is changing with more focus on making enough money, rather than the quality of it's care. It's sad.

pros: Good PTO, dedicated staff, ability to help patients at vulnerable time
cons: Nurses are leaving in droves. Caseloads are through the roof, averaging 20+ patients per nurse and these are case managed patients, not safe. An average caseload should be about 14 patients to adequately manage their needs, keeping in mind these are dying patients who need much TLC. There is a quota of 20 visits per week which is manageable unless one of your patients goes south and you spend 4 hours getting them settled. Now to the on call. With so many nurses leaving your on call averages one weekend every 5 weeks and one full night each week. You can guarantee you will be called out to make back up visits, you are paid 50 dollars per visit regardless if you spend 30 minutes or 3 hours with that patient. Charting is supposed to be completed electronically at the bedside but is impossible due to the volume of patients that demand your attention. The result is spending until 10 or 11 at night charting or 5-6 hours on the weekend completing it. I used to love this job, it is very rewarding and fulfilling, now I resent the time it is taking away from my personal life and family time. Once upon a time you were treated as you should be when guiding folks through the journey to a comfortable and peaceful death. Initial orientation spends a lot of time preaching a work/life balance that is just not possible what is expected/required at this time. Now the focus is " get over it and here is another patient". Dealing with death and dying patients takes a toll on your mind body and emotions but this does not seem to matter any more. This is being reflected in the family satisfaction surveys, which are routinely shared with the staff making them even more discouraged. Any nurse worth her salt wants to do a good job at any cost and sharing the results adds shame.

job_title: Staff RN in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Not a stressful job, I truly love what I am doing for once in my career.
cons: The pay is absolutely disgraceful! Once again orientation boasts of organizational caring and benefits you will never see.

pros: Good pay. Love helping people and really love the job but leadership makes this job the impossible dream.
cons:
Admissions is not a good department. Low staffed, rude clinical coordinators who expect the impossible be done with very low number of staff. Treated like slaves, micromanaged like you are a kindergartener. Not treated like professional adults. No work, life balance. Employees are belittled and made fun of when they ask questions that even the clinical coordinators have no idea of the answers. The higher ups don’t care about the employees either. They tell you that you are salary and have no respect for your off time. Expect you to work over your time for zero pay.
No support in this stressful job. My god, you are dealing with death and dying and they want you to sell Hospice to everyone. If patients or families refuse Hospice services and you report to the clinical coordinators they ask like you did something wrong and you get the third degree on why you don’t sell Hospice. So low staffed you cannot even take your vacation time that you earned. Only way to get a day off is to call in sick. Morale is at an all time low and all they care about is numbers!
Avoid this department at all costs. 
If there is a failure anywhere in the admission process the clinical coordinators treat the nurse as they did something wrong, mean and nasty and accusing without knowing the full story.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Clearwater, FL
pros: The best leadership. The CEO listens to employees and is open to new ideas. Ongoing training is provided and best practices are taught . You have autonomy, support, and a great team oriented environment. I love my job.
cons: It can get busy and flexibility is a must but both are pluses as well.

pros: Been with Empath Health for 3 years and have transferred departments and been promoted twice.  This organization recognizes internal candidates and provides opportunity to transfer between departments to gain experience.
cons: competitive industry, highly regulated as are all healthcare organizations.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Pros are flexibility and many work options.
cons: The institute is being mismanaged into the ground. Directors are paranoid, the culture has fallen apart.  Suspicion is everywhere.  It is so very sad. Suncoast hospice was once an amazing institution.

job_title: Home Health Care Team Assistant in Clearwater, FL
pros: The nurses and aides I worked with were amazing!
cons: There was a lot of micromanaging. Too many cooks in the kitchen as they say. I sent the same information to about 5 people everyday.

pros: Great team support. Strives for quality and puts patient and family at forefront. Pain and symptom management excellent overall
cons: Backup on call and too many hours worked for salary position when full time

review_title: Big changes were taking place and not in a good way

Salary position and easily worked 50-60 hours every week

pros: the patients are so grateful

pros: A culture of caring. Opportunities to grow as a professional by expanding knowledge and responsibilities. Voices are heard.

pros: Very caring staff who provide compassionate and quality care at end of life. The benefits are adequate and the paid time off generous.

review_title: Very surprisingly satsifying. I love going to work everyday

pros: Great mission and vision statement to care for terminal ill clients regardless of the client's ability to pay for services.
cons: Lack of successful communication skills, department managers.

pros: good employees, benefits okay, very fulfilling work

pros: Helping people and their families in one of the most difficult times in life.

review_title: It went from my dream job to a nightmare.

pros: Meaningful work is being done by this company

pros: Great co-workers, positive team environment

review_title: Where Coming to Work Makes You Feel Good Inside
pros: Caring environment; excellent benefits; respected organization; service with heart
cons: No cons - filling required space
